page.title: 17Lanes in Brenchley & Matf'ld
page.content: One of the penalties we are all paying for the{misuse of weed_killer is the gradual disappearance of our country lanes and their flora and fauna.Weed_killer is used along the verge edges of our narrow lanes; everything growing is destroyed; the rain falls,and the bare earth is washed away from the sides of the roads leaving dangerous edges.The council come along and lay tarmac over these edges.Later on when the roads are resurfaced,they are mended to the limits of the new tarmac,{widening the {road,}making way for bigger and heavier lorries.The edges of the road are really unstable because they have no foundation. Alas, we are being robbed of our peaceful flower and animal populated country lanes.
